titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 25: a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 25
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. The excerpt is from the Tuesday October 25, 1825 session of court, in which several cases were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Tuesday 25
div.p:
Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors
J John Martin
&C et cetera Jurors &C

Susanna Otterlifter
Ptf Plaintiff
vs
Jessee E. Bean
Dft Defendant

Jacob Seabolt Ptf
vs
Taylor Eldridge Dft

appeal from from
Amoiah Amoah district

Archy Foreman Ptf
vs
William Blythe Dft

Betsey Walker Ptf
vs
William Blythe

Mrs Seunnataye Ptf
vs
George Hicks Dft

Quaquah Jacks wife Ptf
vs
Young Squirrel Dft

Jessee Bushey Head Ptf
vs
Salley Rain Crow Dft

The Scraper & Co. Company Ptf
vs
Polley Lovet Dft

Nathaniel Peake Ptf
vs
Cheanankaah Dft

Jackson &c McConnel Ptfs
vs
Bridge Maker & Wife Dfts

The court recognise recognize the will of Samuel Riley, Deceased, to be his last will and testament as authenticated by the deposition of R Richards
Phisician Physician who attended on said Saml Samuel Riley decd. deceased in his last sickness, Given from under my hand at New Town this 25th of October 1825

closer.add: Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
